intro: Thymelina, commonly known as the sweetgum tree, is a deciduous tree belonging to the family Sapindaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped leaves and clusters of small, urn-shaped flowers. The plant produces spiny, spherical fruits that contain numerous seeds. Thymelina is native to the southeastern United States and thrives in a variety of soil types. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for landscaping and urban environments.
